page.title: 02FARMLAND ON BISHOPSTONE DOWN
page.content: FIVE FARMERS ARE ENGAGED IN CULTIVATING LAND IN THIS AREA. EACH HAS A STRIP OF FIELDS RUNNING NORTH WEST TO SOUTH EAST ACROSS IT.THE DIVISION OF THE LAND WAS ORIGINALLY MADE SO THAT EACH FARMER RECEIVED SOME OF THE BETTER SOIL IN THE VALLEY AS WELL AS A SHARE OF THE THINNER CHALKY SOIL OF THE DOWNS. THIS STILL APPLIES TODAY. MIXED FARMING IS PRACTISED BY ALL FIVE FARMERS. THE FIELDS ARE USED IN ROTATION FOR CROPS OF WHEAT BARLEY AND OATS AS WELL AS FOR SILAGE AND GRAZING LAND FOR SHEEP AND CATTLE. SOME FEW AREAS ARE DIFFICULT BY REASON OF THEIR STEEP NATURE SO CANNOT BE PLOUGHED. THESE ARE SOMETIMES PERMANENT PASTURE OR SOMETIMES ROUGH UNCULTIVATED GRASSLAND.
